subject: Football
lead_paragraph: For the third time in four years, Southern California will begin the season ranked No. 1 in the Associated Press top 25 poll. U.S.C. received 62 of 65 first-place votes and 1,622 points from a panel of news media members in the poll released yesterday. No. 2 Louisiana State, with two, and West Virginia had the other first-place votes. Texas, Michigan, the defending national champion Florida, Wisconsin, Oklahoma, Virginia Tech and Louisville round out the top 10. Ohio State, last year’s preseason No. 1, is at No. 11. Rutgers, ranked 16th, and No. 23 Hawaii are in the preseason poll for the first time.
